Speaker: may 29, 2012
Dialogue: BLACK.

Speaker: card 1
Dialogue: AT 600 KM ABOVE PLANET EARTH THE TEMPERATURE FLUCTUATES BETWEEN 120 AND -100 DEGREES CELSIUS.

Speaker: card 2
Dialogue: THERE IS NOTHING TO CARRY SOUND, NO OXYGEN, AND NO AIR PRESSURE.

Speaker: card 3
Dialogue: LIFE HERE IS IMPOSSIBLE.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: DMA M1, M2, M3 and M4 are complete.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Copy that Explorer. Dr Stone-Houston, requesting status update...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Installation ninety-five percent complete. Running level one diagnostics on circuits, sensors, and power. Standby.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Standing by. Looks like we're on schedule. Dr. Stone, Medical is concerned about your ECG readings.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm fine Houston.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Well, medical doesn't agree doctor. Are you feeling nauseous?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Not any more than usual, Houston. Diagnostics are green. Linking to communications card. Ready for data reception. If this works, when we touch down tomorrow, I'm buying all you guys a round of drinks.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: That's a date, doctor. Just remember, Houston is partial to Margaritas.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: OK, here we go... Booting comm card now. Please confirm link.  Negative. We're not seeing any data.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Stand by, Houston. I'm gonna reboot the comm card.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Standing by.

Speaker: astronaut
Dialogue: Houston, I have a bad feeling about this mission.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Please expand.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Okay, let me tell you a story. It was '96. I'd been up here 42 days. Every time I passed over Texas, I'd look down, knowing the second Mrs Kowalsky, was looking up, thinking of me. Six weeks I'm blowing kisses to that woman. Then we land at Edwards and I find out she'd run off with a lawyer before I was off the launch pad, so I packed my car and I headed to...

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Tijuana. You've told this story, Kowalsky. As Houston recalls, she took off in your '74 GTO. Engineering requests fuel status on the jet pack prototype.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Five hours off the reservation and I show 30% drain. My compliments to Engineering. Except for a slight malfunction on the nulling of the roll axis, this jetpack is one prime piece of thrust. MISSION CONTROL  Engineering says thank you.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Tell them I still prefer my '67 Corvette though. Speaking of which did I ever tell you the--

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: We know the Corvette story, Matt.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Even Engineering?

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Especially engineering. We're going to miss you, Matt.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Comm card reboot in progress.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Thank you doctor. Shariff, what's your status?

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Nearly there. Replacing battery module A1 and C.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Could you be more specific? Indeterminate estimates make Houston anxious. SHARIFF No... no... no Houston, don't be anxious. Anxiety is not good for the heart... The system is ready to re- activate.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Hubble Telescope engaged. Upgrade fully functional. That applause you hear is for you, Shariff. Congratulations. Kick back, take the rest of the day off.

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Woohoo... Jaise Baadal Paani Ka, Yaarana Hai Oh Jaise Paani Ka, Yaarana Hai.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Matt, please advise as to Mission Specialist Shariff's current activity.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: He appears to be doing the Macarena of some sort. Though that would merely be a best guess scenario on my part.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Dr. Stone. Houston. Medical now have you with a temperature drop to 35.9 and heart rate rise to 70. How are you doing?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Houston, I'm fine, it's just...  ...Keeping your lunch down in zero G is harder than it looks. MISSION CONTROL Doctor Stone? Medical is asking if you want to return to Explorer?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No, we've been here for a week Houston, let's just finish this.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: That's a negative. I'm afraid we're getting nothing on this end, doctor.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Try again.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Still nothing.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Houston, could you please turn that music off?

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Kowalsky?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Not a problem.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Thank you, Kowalsky.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Could Houston be misinterpreting the data--?

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: We're not receiving any data. Engineering is recommending a vis- check for component damage.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Mmmm. Let me see what's going on.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: That seems to be the case. Engineering admits that you warned us that this could happen. That's as close to an apology as you're going to get from them. We should've listened to you doc.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm on it.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Copy that. How long do you think it'll take you?

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Outstanding. We appreciate your patience, Doctor. Installing your system in the Hubble is the main purpose of this mission.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Seventy-five minutes shy. Never crossed my mind.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Matt, It's been a privilege.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Right back atcha, Houston.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Enjoy your last walk...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Am I a go to assist Dr. Stone in removing the panel?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Assistance appreciated.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Mind if I join the fun?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Certainly.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: How are you feeling?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Like a Chihuahua that's being tumble dried.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's been a rough week. If it makes you feel any better, I puked up everything but my kidneys on my first ride.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Whoa...! AWOL!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Hey -- you're the genius up here. I just drive this bus.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Call me a genius if I can get this board initialized in the next hour.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Explorer, this is Houston.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: Go ahead Houston.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: NORAD reports a satellite has incurred a missile strike. The impact has created a cloud of debris orbiting at 20,000 miles per hour. Current debris orbit does not overlap with your trajectory. We'll keep you posted on any developments.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Should we be worried?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Let the boys down there worry for us.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Explorer, engage arm and pivot to cargo bay.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: Standby for arm maneuver.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: So doc, now that you work for NASA, how do you like it?

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Kinda like winning the lottery, isn't it?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: How long was your training?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Six months.

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Including holidays?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: So, what is this scanning system?

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Nothing rad, it's just a new set of eyes to scan the universe.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Assuming it works, it's just for hospital use. This one is a prototype.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: Standby for marking.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Listen, they don't bankroll prototypes, even for your pretty blue eyes.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: My eyes are brown.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Right now your eyes are blood shut.

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Kowalsky!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: And to think he went to Harvard.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Mm-hm.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: "Mmm?" So what do you like about being up here?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: The silence.  I could get used to it.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Hmmmm. Terrific.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Houston, from first inspection comms panel appears to be dead. Am I a go to cut link to auxiliary? MISSION CONTROL You're the expert, doctor. It's your call.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Houston, I have a bad feeling about this mission.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Please elaborate.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's the same feeling I had at Mardi

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: That is affirmative. Surprisingly, control hasn't heard the Mardi Gras story. Please proceed.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Well, it's day one and I'm bumping my way down Bourbon Street looking for the sister of a friend of mine. The streets are swimming with people, I'm thinking there's no way I'm finding this girl...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Proceeding to over ride.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Then all of a sudden I look up and -- there she is.  I am about to yell out when I notice she's holding hands with a short hairy guy in board shorts and a Margaritaville T-shirt. Then I realize, the guy's no guy. My sister's friend is holding hands with a--

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: ISS, this is Houston.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Explorer, this is Houston.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: Go ahead Houston.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Mission abort. Repeat: mission abort. Initiate emergency disconnect from Hubble.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: Copy all Houston, and in work. Matt, immediate return to Explorer. Repeat, immediate return to Explorer.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Roger. Explorer, prep airlock! EXPLORER CAP  Airlock engaged--ready to receive.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Houston. Elaborate.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Debris from the impact has caused a chain reaction, hitting other satellites in its path and creating new debris. Norad reports that orbital and ballistic effects are driving the cloud of debris up toward your altitude. How copy?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Copy all Houston.  Put a bow on it Dr. Stone.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I can't. If I turn it off now we'll lose the whole system.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I'm not going to ask you again.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: ONE SECOND--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Not one second. Now! Shut it down! THAT'S AN ORDER!!!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Sorry. I'm sorry. It's done.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Alright Shariff, let's do this.

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Roger.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Houston. Update.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: We have a full on chain reaction. It's been confirmed that it is the unintentional side effect of the Russians striking one of their own satellites.

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: They shot down their own satellite?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Right of disposal. Most likely a spy sat gone bad. Now it's space junk.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: Locks releasing in three... two... one...

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Explorer, new data coming through.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: It's not good. Most of our systems are going down. Debris chain reaction is out of control and rapidly expanding. Multiple sats are now down and they keep on falling.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Define "multiple" sats.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Most of them. Telecomunications systems are gone. Expect a communication blackout at any moment.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Kowalsky, visual of debris at nine o'clock.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Half of North America just lost their Facebook.

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: You're a go for TH1138. Repeat You're a go for TH1138 procedure.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: Copy that Houston.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Explorer, this is Kowalsky. Confirming visual contact with debris. Debris is from a BSE sat. To repeat--

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Heads up!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: To repeat I have-

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We have to go. Go, go! Go!

Speaker: mission control
Dialogue: Attention. New data suggests immediate evacuation absolu...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Dr. Stone requesting faster transport to the bay area. Explorer get me down.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Explorer permission to retrieve Dr. Stone.

Speaker: explorer cap
Dialogue: You are a go, Kowalsky.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Unstrap! You can't tune out the world up here.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm trying...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Try releasing the safety clip.

Speaker: shariff
Dialogue: Need some help there Matt?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: No, don't wait for us. Get inside.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: It's stuck!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Man down! Man down!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Nooooo!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You must detach!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: If you don't detach that arm is going to carry you too far! RYAN  I can't!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Listen to my voice. You need to focus. I'm losing visual of you. In a few seconds I won't be able to track you.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ok. Ok.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You need to detach. I can't see you anymore.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm trying. I'm trying.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Do it. Now!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ok. I'm trying! I can't it's stuck, Hold on.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Houston, I've lost visual of Dr. Stone... Houston, I've lost visual of Dr. Stone.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: ...Give me your position!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I don't know. I don't know! I'm spinning. I can't. I can't.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Report your position.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: GPS is...down. I can't, it's down, I can't.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Give me a visual.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I told you! Nothing. I see nothing!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Do you have a visual of Explorer?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: NO--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Do you have a visual of ISS?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: NO--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I need you to focus. Give me a visual... anything.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: ... Stone. Do you copy?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Lieutenant Kowalsky?...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Repeat. Do you copy?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: YES! YES! I copy! I'm here!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Flash your light.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: My light?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: So I can see you.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Here! Here!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: There you are. Hang tight. Report your status.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm... I'm alright... I'm fine. MATT  Your status! Give me your readings?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Steady at eight percent...no seven...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You're breathing too fast. You're burning oxygen. We don't want to do that. We want to relax. Copy.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Copy.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Nearly there.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Please hurry.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You can holster that torch, Dr. Stone.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Oh. Sorry.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Gotcha.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Arghh!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Now, I'm going to tether you to me. Ryan is paralyzed, holding onto Matt tightly and looking at him in fright. He stares back.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Okay. Okay. Okay. Okay, Ohh I got it.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ok. So far so good. Now listen. I'm going to give you a little push, just so you're clear of the jets--

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: NO--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Sorry. Not a push, more like a nudge.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No... No... No... Wait... Don't.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: See? Where you go, I go.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ahh Dammit!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I know what you mean.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ahhh Dammit.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You're burning oxygen, we're going to go back to the shuttle. How's that for a plan. Copy?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: FUCK

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Right copy that.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Why aren't they answering?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It seems like communications are lost.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Can they hear us on an alternate frequency? MATT We don't know. That's why we keep talking. If someone is listening they might just save your life. Set your watch for ninety minutes.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Why ninety?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Houston clocked that debris at fifty thousand miles per hour. Factoring in our current orbit, I reckon we've got 90 minutes before we play duck and cover again.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: 02 down to six percent.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Okay. Pretty scary shit being untethered up here, isn't it?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Yeah. Pretty scary shit.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You did all right.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Where is he? Where is he?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Grab him!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm trying. I'm trying.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Quick. You're pulling me away.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I got him. I got him.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Clutch him like he's your Valentine. I can't gauge my thrust with you two yo- yoing around.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Jesus...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: 02 down to five percent.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: All right, here we go. Careful of the edges.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I apologize for not complying. I should've stopped working as soon as you instructed me to.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We were going to be hit no matter what. There was nothing you could've done to change that.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Alright... We have to get ourselves to the Space Station. There.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Agreed.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Alright. After you.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: 02 down to two percent.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: We're getting there.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: The sunrise. That's what I'm going to miss the most.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Home?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ah ha. Down there. Mother Earth. Where do you pitch your tent?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Lake Zurich.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Where the hell is that? RYAN Illinois.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Illinois. Central time zone. That makes it roughly... 8pm right now. What are the good people of Lake Zurich doing at 8 o'clock in the evening?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What would you be doing?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: The radio. I listen to the radio...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: There we go. Let me guess. NPR? Classical. Top for--

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Anything. Doesn't matter. As long as they don't talk. I just drive...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What do you miss down there?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Nobody special? Someone down there, looking up, thinking of you?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I had a daughter.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What was her name?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Sarah... She was four. Stupidest thing- a school trip to the swimming pool. She was playing tag- she slipped, hit her head, and that was it... She loved tag. I'm sure she was laughing.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Uhuh?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: The good news is we're five minutes from the ISS and I know where the Russians stash their vodka... and that's a good thing cus I'm running out of fumes. Bad news is I'm gonna be ten minutes short of......breaking Anatoly's record.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Mmm...Mmmm.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm red lining... My O2 tank pressure is low...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: The tank may be empty but there's still oxygen in your suit, so sip, Ryan. Don't gulp. It's wine, not beer. Sip. We'll get you there.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Shouldn't we be turning? We're DRIFTING AGAIN--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Sip, Ryan. Sip. Drifting is good. We want to drift. I wasn't kidding about those fumes. This can has one or two good thrusts left. If we're lucky....

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Break... You have to break.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I can't. Can's empty. We're coming in fast and we're going to hit hard. Grab onto anything you can and hold tight!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I got it. I got it.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Grab a hold. Grab anything.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I've got you. I've got you--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Shit... shit...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No. No. No. Don't you. No. Don't you. Don't. Don't. NO

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You have to let me go.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: What? No--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You have to.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Those ropes are too loose, I'm pulling you with me. You have to let me go or we both die--

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm not letting you go! We're fine.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ryan! RYAN You're not going anywhere, you're not GOING ANYWHERE--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's not up to you.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Please don't do this.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You're going to make it Ryan.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ryan do you copy? Do you copy?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: My CO2 alarm went off. My CO2 alarm went off.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You need to board the station. Can you see the airlock?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Yes. Yes. I see it. I see it.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Good. That's where you want to go. You're losing focus, right?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: That's because you're breathing CO2 and you're losing consciousness. You need to board the Station.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ok.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Now listen to me. That second Soyuz is too damaged for re-entry, but it's perfectly fine for a little Sunday drive.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Sunday drive...?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Look to the west... You see that dot in the distance? That is the Chinese Station. You're going to take the Soyuz and cruise over there. The Chinese lifeboat is a Shenzou. RYAN I've never flown a Shenzhou--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: That doesn't matter. Its re-entry protocol is identical to the Soyuz's--

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ok.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You've never flown a Soyuz either.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Only on a simulator.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: So then you know.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I crashed it. I--

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's a Simulator. That's what it's designed for.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Every time. I crashed the Simulator every time.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's not rocket science. Just point the damn thing at earth and by this time tomorrow you'll be back in Lake Zurich with one hell of a story to tell. You copy? Ryan. You copy?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm going to take the Soyuz and come get you.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: No you're not. . I have too much of a head start. That ship already sailed. RYAN No. I'm coming to get you.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ryan, you're going to have to learn to let go.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: But... I...

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I want to hear you say you're going to make it.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I'm... I'm going to make it.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Alright. Keep going

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Dad wanted a boy.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Are you close to the airlock?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Not yet.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Keep going.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: What? MATT Well, people say I have beautiful blue eyes.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: You... you have beautiful... you have beautiful blue eyes.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I have brown eyes... that hurts.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I'm going to break Anatoly's record, and I think mine's going to stand for a long, long time.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No... I'm coming to get you.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: You know, Ryan is a nice name for a girl. Wow, you should see the sun on the Ganges. It's amazing.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Matt...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Come on, come on.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Matt. This is Ryan. Copy? She waits.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: OK... where was it?... where was it? She moves her finger across the different buttons, searching.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I engaged manual control- R O A K and RYD are activated.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Oh, no. No, no, no.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Great. Fantastic. Perfect.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Clear skies but with a chance of satellite debris. SHE HUMS A SONG, the tune is reminiscent of the Hank Williams Melody that Matt had played earlier.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Shut up!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: One...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Come on. Come on!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: You gotta be kidding me.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: This is Dr Ryan Stone, can you hear me? Houston, this is Ryan Stone, can you hear me? Copy? Houston, this is Ryan Stone, can you hear me? Copy?

Dialogue: Houston, this is Ryan Stone, can you hear me? Copy? Houston, this is Ryan Stone, can you hear me? Copy?

Speaker: transmission
Dialogue: Mayday! Ieukpalliktuq uumaruq taigaa naabuqtuq.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Are those dogs? Those are dogs! Are you calling from Earth?!

Speaker: transmission
Dialogue: Ieukpalliktuq naabuqtuq.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Is it beautiful where you are? Here it's colder than hell and lonelier than shit, but it's beautiful Aningang. Utterly, terrifyingly beautiful.

Speaker: transmission
Dialogue: Suli aasrivak aatqatik niuruq...?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Dogs! Woof. Woof. Woof.

Speaker: transmission
Dialogue: Auuu. Auuu. Oipmiq. Oipmiq! Auuu. Auuu.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Woof. Woof.

Speaker: transmission
Dialogue: Auuu... Auuu...

Speaker: transmission
Dialogue: Ieukpalliktuq upatimi...

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: You are singing to your baby? Is that a lullaby? That's so sweet!

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ahhhh! Alright, check your watch. 13 hours, 11 minutes. Call Anatoly, tell him he's been bumped.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: How did you?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Trust me, it's a hell of a story. RYAN But how did you?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: That's better.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: How?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: I found a little extra battery power. I'm just happy you're still alive. To be honest, I thought your chances were slim to none. By the way, did you find the vodka?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: You never told me where.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Oh well... To Anatoly! Na zdorovje.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: No? Right, let's get out of here.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: We can't.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Course we can. RYAN There's no fuel. I tried everything.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Well, there's always something we can do.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I tried everything.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Did you try the soft landing jets?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: They're for landing so.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Well landing is launching it's the same thing, didn't you learn about that in training?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: I never got to land the simulator, I told you.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: But you know about it.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: And I crashed it every time.

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Listen you want to go back or do you want to stay here? I get it, it's nice up here, you can just shut down all the systems turn out all the lights, and just close your eyes and tune out everybody.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: How did you get here?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: Ryan, you have to learn to let go ... Hey?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: matt
Dialogue: It's time to go home.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Landing, landing. Landing is launching.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Okay Houston, here comes the tricky part, the Soyuz has to think we're only three meters above the earth.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Wow... you were right Matt... it's magnificent....

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ahhhhhh!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Come on. Come on.

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Seriously?

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: In the Soyuz the power button is erm....here!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Ok. That doesn't sound good....

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Yeehaaa!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: AAAHHHHHH!

Speaker: ryan
Dialogue: Thank you.
